name: Power BI Best Practices - Comprehensive Rules
description: Complete set of best practice rules for Power BI models based on Microsoft official guidelines, Tabular Editor BPA, and community standards
author: Based on Microsoft, Tabular Editor, and Power BI community standards

rules.Name: Avoid bi-directional relationships
rules.Description: Bi-directional cross-filtering can create ambiguous query paths and significantly impact performance. Use single-direction relationships whenever possible.

rules.Name: Avoid many-to-many relationships
rules.Description: Many-to-many relationships can cause severe performance issues and unexpected results. Use bridge tables with two one-to-many relationships instead.

rules.Name: Remove unused columns
rules.Description: Columns that are not used in any relationships, measures, hierarchies, or visuals should be removed to reduce model size and improve performance.

rules.Name: Remove unused measures
rules.Description: Measures that are not used in any visuals or other measures should be removed to reduce clutter.

rules.Name: Use DIVIDE function instead of division operator
rules.Description: The DIVIDE function is safer than the / operator as it handles division by zero automatically, returning BLANK or a specified alternate result.

rules.Name: Avoid excessive use of CALCULATE
rules.Description: Multiple nested CALCULATE functions can be simplified for better readability and may impact performance. Consider restructuring the measure.

rules.Name: Avoid SUMX(FILTER(...)) pattern
rules.Description: SUMX(FILTER(...)) is inefficient. Use CALCULATE with filter arguments instead for significantly better performance.

rules.Name: Avoid AVERAGEX(FILTER(...)) pattern
rules.Description: AVERAGEX(FILTER(...)) is inefficient. Use CALCULATE with filter arguments instead.

rules.Name: Set IsAvailableInMdx to false on non-attribute columns
rules.Description: Columns that are not attributes should have IsAvailableInMdx set to false to improve processing and query performance in MDX queries.
rules.Expression: IsAvailableInMdx == true and not IsKey and not RegEx.IsMatch(Name, "(ID|Key)$")

rules.Name: Provide format string for measures
rules.Description: All measures should have a format string defined for consistent display across all visuals and reports.

rules.Name: Add descriptions to measures
rules.Description: Measures should have descriptions to help report creators and users understand their purpose and calculation logic.

rules.Name: Hide foreign key columns
rules.Description: Foreign key columns used only in relationships should be hidden from report view to reduce clutter.

rules.Name: Mark date tables as date tables
rules.Description: Tables containing date columns should be marked as date tables using 'Mark as Date Table' for proper time intelligence functionality.

rules.Name: Avoid using calculated columns in relationships
rules.Description: Calculated columns in relationships can cause severe performance issues during refresh. Use source data columns or M transformations instead.

rules.Name: Hide high cardinality columns
rules.Description: High cardinality columns (ID, GUID, timestamps) should be hidden if not needed for filtering to significantly reduce memory usage.

rules.Name: Use variables (VAR) for complex expressions
rules.Description: Complex measures should use VAR for better readability, easier debugging, and potentially better performance through query plan optimization.

rules.Name: Avoid Float/Double for financial calculations
rules.Description: Float (Double) data type can cause precision issues in financial calculations. Use Decimal (Currency) or Fixed Decimal type instead.

rules.Name: Remove empty partitions
rules.Description: Tables should not have empty partitions as they serve no purpose and can cause confusion during development.

rules.Name: Set data category for geographic columns
rules.Description: Geographic columns should have appropriate data categories set (City, Country, Continent, etc.) to enable map visuals and geocoding.

rules.Name: Organize measures in display folders
rules.Description: Measures should be organized in display folders for better discoverability. Tables with more than 10 measures should use folder organization.

rules.Name: Avoid unnecessary iterator functions
rules.Description: Use simple aggregation functions (SUM, AVERAGE, etc.) instead of iterators (SUMX, AVERAGEX) when not needed for significantly better performance.

rules.Name: Avoid CALCULATE/CALCULATETABLE in iterator functions
rules.Description: Using CALCULATE or CALCULATETABLE inside iterator functions (SUMX, FILTER, etc.) causes row-by-row context transition and severely impacts performance.

rules.Name: Use COUNTROWS instead of COUNTROWS(FILTER(ALL(...)))
rules.Description: COUNTROWS(FILTER(ALL(...))) is inefficient. Use CALCULATE(COUNTROWS(...), ALL(...)) for better performance.

rules.Name: Set Sort By Column for month names
rules.Description: Month name columns should have Sort By Column set to month number for correct chronological sorting in visuals.

rules.Name: Consider TREATAS instead of USERELATIONSHIP
rules.Description: In many cases, TREATAS is more efficient than USERELATIONSHIP for role-playing dimensions and can be more flexible.

rules.Name: Avoid using IFERROR and ISERROR
rules.Description: IFERROR and ISERROR can hide calculation errors and impact performance. Use explicit error handling with IF and DIVIDE instead.

rules.Name: Minimize use of calculated columns
rules.Description: Calculated columns consume memory and are calculated during refresh. Consider using measures or M transformations instead when possible.

rules.Name: Don't use aggregation functions in calculated columns
rules.Description: Aggregation functions (SUM, AVERAGE, etc.) in calculated columns cause row-context to filter-context transition, severely impacting performance. Use measures instead.

rules.Name: Disable Auto Date/Time
rules.Description: Auto Date/Time creates hidden date tables for every date column, significantly increasing model size. Use explicit date tables instead.

rules.Name: Set Summarize By to None for non-numeric columns
rules.Description: Text and boolean columns should have Summarize By set to None to prevent accidental aggregation in visuals.

rules.Name: Avoid DAX reserved keywords in object names
rules.Description: Using DAX reserved keywords as table or column names requires brackets and can cause confusion. Avoid names like 'Table', 'Date', 'Value', etc.

rules.Name: Visible measures should be in a dedicated measure table
rules.Description: Visible measures should be organized in one or more dedicated measure tables (no columns) for better organization and performance.

rules.Name: Avoid leading/trailing whitespace in names
rules.Description: Leading or trailing whitespace in object names can cause issues and confusion. Trim all names.

rules.Name: Avoid duplicate measure names across tables
rules.Description: Measures with the same name in different tables can cause confusion and DAX errors. Use unique names or prefixes.

rules.Name: Remove inactive relationships if not used
rules.Description: Inactive relationships that are never used with USERELATIONSHIP should be removed to simplify the model.

rules.Name: Provide descriptions for complex calculated columns
rules.Description: Calculated columns with complex expressions should have descriptions explaining their purpose and logic.

rules.Name: Use SELECTEDVALUE instead of VALUES for scalar
rules.Description: When expecting a single value, use SELECTEDVALUE instead of VALUES for better performance and automatic BLANK handling.

rules.Name: Avoid ISBLANK with && or ||
rules.Description: Using ISBLANK with logical operators can be simplified. Use COALESCE or handle BLANK directly for better performance.

rules.Name: Consider using KEEPFILTERS
rules.Description: When adding filters in CALCULATE, consider if KEEPFILTERS is needed to avoid overwriting existing filter context.

rules.Name: Avoid nested FILTER functions
rules.Description: Nested FILTER functions create Cartesian products and severely impact performance. Combine filter conditions with && or use CALCULATE with multiple filters.

rules.Name: Use perspectives for complex models
rules.Description: Complex models with many objects should use perspectives to organize objects for different user roles or use cases.

rules.Name: Don't use ALL with SELECTEDVALUE
rules.Description: Using ALL() with SELECTEDVALUE is redundant. SELECTEDVALUE already handles filter context.

rules.Name: Be careful with ALLSELECTED
rules.Description: ALLSELECTED behavior depends on where filters are applied (visual, page, report). Document its usage and test thoroughly.

rules.Name: Use ISBLANK instead of ISEMPTY
rules.Description: For scalar values, ISBLANK is more efficient than ISEMPTY. Reserve ISEMPTY for table expressions only.

rules.Name: Set appropriate default summarization
rules.Description: Numeric columns should have appropriate default summarization (Sum, Average, None) set based on their semantic meaning.
rules.Expression: (DataType == "Int64" or DataType == "Double" or DataType == "Decimal") and SummarizeBy == "Sum" and RegEx.IsMatch(Name, "(ID|Key|Rank|Number|Count|Year|Month|Day)", "(?i)")

rules.Name: Avoid Unicode whitespace in expressions
rules.Description: Unicode whitespace characters (non-breaking spaces, etc.) can cause hard-to-debug issues. Use regular spaces only.

rules.Name: Verify relationship cardinality is correct
rules.Description: Many-to-one relationships should have the 'many' side on the fact table and the 'one' side on the dimension table.

rules.Name: Hide unnecessary fact table columns
rules.Description: Fact table foreign keys and technical columns should be hidden. Only measures and business-relevant columns should be visible.
rules.Expression: not IsHidden and Table.Name.Contains("Fact") and (RegEx.IsMatch(Name, "(ID|Key|FK)$", "(?i)") or DataType == "DateTime")

rules.Name: Hide dimension surrogate keys
rules.Description: Dimension table surrogate keys used only for relationships should be hidden from report view.
rules.Expression: not IsHidden and Table.Name.Contains("Dim") and RegEx.IsMatch(Name, "Key$|ID$", "(?i)")

rules.Name: Use single-column relationships
rules.Description: Relationships should be based on single columns. Composite keys should be concatenated into a single column in the source query.

rules.Name: Remove columns with no data
rules.Description: Columns that contain no data (all BLANK) should be removed from the model.

rules.Name: Prefer SELECTEDVALUE over HASONEVALUE+VALUES
rules.Description: The pattern IF(HASONEVALUE(...), VALUES(...)) can be replaced with SELECTEDVALUE for better readability and performance.

rules.Name: Avoid CROSSJOIN for large tables
rules.Description: CROSSJOIN creates Cartesian products and can cause memory issues with large tables. Use GENERATE or relationship-based filtering instead.

rules.Name: Verify data types are appropriate
rules.Description: Columns should use the most appropriate data type. For example, whole numbers should use Int64, not Double.

rules.Name: Minimize ADDCOLUMNS in measures
rules.Description: ADDCOLUMNS can be memory-intensive for large tables. Consider if the calculation can be done in the source query or as a calculated column.

rules.Name: Use FORMAT function carefully
rules.Description: FORMAT function converts to text and can be slow for large datasets. Use format strings on measures when possible, or consider doing formatting in Power Query.

rules.Name: Use LASTDATE/FIRSTDATE correctly
rules.Description: LASTDATE and FIRSTDATE should be used in time intelligence calculations, not for filtering. They can cause unexpected results when used as filters.

rules.Name: Avoid non-optimized functions when alternatives exist
rules.Description: Some DAX functions like FIND, SEARCH, SUBSTITUTE are not optimized. Consider doing string transformations in Power Query instead.

rules.Name: Date table should meet all requirements
rules.Description: Date tables must be continuous (no gaps), include all dates in the data, and be marked as a date table. They should also have year, month, and quarter columns.

rules.Name: Don't use approximation functions in production
rules.Description: Approximation functions (APPROXIMATEDISTINCTCOUNT) trade accuracy for performance. They should not be used in production without explicit approval.

rules.Name: Verify RELATED direction
rules.Description: RELATED traverses many-to-one relationships. RELATEDTABLE traverses one-to-many. Verify the relationship direction is correct.

rules.Name: Use incremental refresh for large tables
rules.Description: Fact tables with millions of rows should use incremental refresh to reduce refresh time and resource usage.

rules.Name: Consider aggregations for large fact tables
rules.Description: Fact tables with millions of rows should consider using aggregation tables for common report queries to improve performance.

rules.Name: Store complex calculations in variables
rules.Description: Complex expressions that are used multiple times in a measure should be stored in variables to avoid recalculation.

rules.Name: Use SUMMARIZE instead of SELECTCOLUMNS without grouping
rules.Description: SELECTCOLUMNS without grouping can create unnecessary rows. Use SUMMARIZE or DISTINCT for grouping operations.

rules.Name: Optimize Row-Level Security for performance
rules.Description: Row-Level Security (RLS) filters are applied to every query. Complex RLS DAX expressions can significantly impact query performance.

rules.Name: Avoid NOW() and TODAY() in measures for performance
rules.Description: NOW() and TODAY() in measures prevent query plan caching. Consider creating a parameter or calculated column instead.

rules.Name: Use SWITCH instead of nested IF
rules.Description: Multiple nested IF statements are hard to read and maintain. Use SWITCH for better readability when checking multiple conditions on the same expression.

rules.Name: Use TOPN carefully in measures
rules.Description: TOPN in measures can be expensive for large tables. Consider if the filtering can be done at the visual level instead.

rules.Name: Use consistent naming conventions
rules.Description: Tables and columns should follow consistent naming conventions (PascalCase, camelCase, or snake_case) throughout the model.
